projectGridLines.title: Title: ETL Orchestration for Large Scale Clustering of Documents
projectGridLines.description:
Title: ETL Orchestration for Large Scale Clustering of Documents

Description:

The "ETL Orchestration for Large Scale Clustering of Documents" project focuses on designing and

implementing an automated pipeline to extract, transform, and load (ETL) large volumes of unstructured

document data into a scalable system. The objective is to preprocess the documents (e.g., text

normalization, tokenization) and perform clustering to identify patterns and group related content. The

orchestration ensures efficient data flow, enabling real-time or batch processing of diverse document

sources. The system will leverage machine learning techniques for clustering, optimizing for

performance, scalability, and ease of integration into existing data infrastructure for large-scale content

analysis.

Skill sets: Python, Argo, Graphs, Numpy, Panda, Clustering Algorithms

Traits expectation: Highly Energetic

Expected learning:

Clustering Algorithms: Learn about different clustering algorithms (e.g., K-means, DBSCAN, hierarchical

clustering) and how to apply them to group similar documents based on their content.

Scalability and Performance Optimization: Explore techniques for scaling data processing and clustering

to handle large datasets efficiently, including parallel processing and distributed computing.

Automation and Orchestration: Develop skills in automating data workflows and orchestrating ETL

tasks, ensuring smooth, error-free processing in production environments.

Integration with Data Systems: Understand how to integrate clustering solutions with existing data

infrastructure, making the system adaptable to different data sources and scalable for growing datasets.

Machine Learning in NLP: Gain practical knowledge in applying machine learning models for

unsupervised learning tasks such as clustering and dimensionality reduction, crucial for document

analysis.

Specific courses required for project execution:

Must Have: Data Structure & Algorithms

Good to Have: Introduction to Machine Learning, Applied Data Science with Python
